basics.name: Kyle Chan
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Department of Engineering at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring 2019.

work.summary: Firmware development and PCB design intern
highlights: Developing firmware in C for polloing sensor data using STM32 microcontrollers
Created data filtering and temperature control algorithms in C for dsPIC microcontrollers
Writing power logging and data conversion scripts in Python for testing sensors
Designing schematics and baord layouts for hyperspectral imaging systems
Populating PCBs using soldering irons and reflow station
Fabricating cables for subsystem interconnects and testing equipment

volunteer.summary: Developer for firmare & algorithms of an autonomous robot
highlights: Used AutoDesk Inventor to model assembly for bracket design
Designed 2 layer PCB with surface mounted components
Developed firmware in C for a STM32 microprocessor to drive DC motors with a closed-loop control system
Designed and developed low-cost, accurate, and reliable environmental sensor modules
Developed firmware in Arduino for an ATmega328 microcontroller to retrieve sensor data

awards.title: UH Manoa Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen who complete a rigorous high school curriculum.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2017.  See my portfolio site for more details.
